thag17.2:1.1_0: “One who’s mindful as per their conduct and mindfulness,
thag17.2:1.2_0: diligent as per their intentions and meditation,
thag17.2:1.4_0: that is what they call a mendicant.
thag17.2:10.1_0: But one who gives up proliferates,
thag17.2:12.2_0: Though most people don’t like it,
thag17.2:12.3_0: those free of greed are happy there,
thag17.2:12.4_0: not those who seek sensual pleasures.
thag17.2:13.1_0: Regard one who sees your faults
thag17.2:13.2_0: sees the fault of the fault,
thag17.2:13.4_0: even for the rest of their life,
thag17.2:14.3_0: For the being dear is loved,
thag17.2:15.1_0: “The Blessed One, the Buddha, the seer
thag17.2:15.4_0: I lent an ear to get the meaning.

thag17.2:17.5_0: not for purifying the power of clairaudience,
thag17.2:18.1_0: “His only shelter is the foot of a tree;
thag17.2:18.3_0: the senior monk foremost in wisdom,
thag17.2:19.2_0: Soṇa, a disciple of the Buddha,
thag17.2:2.1_0: When eating fresh or dried food,
thag17.2:2.4_0: with unfilled belly, taking limited food.
thag17.2:20.3_0: A mendicant who has ended delusion
thag17.2:20.4_0: a monk, like a mountain, doesn’t tremble.
thag17.2:21.1_0: “To the man who has not a blemish,
thag17.2:21.4_0: seems as big as a cloud.”
thag17.2:22.3_0: I will lay down this body,
thag17.2:23.3_0: I’m enjoying the time for time,

thag17.2:24.1_0: “Both what came before and what follows after

thag17.2:34.1_0: “The senior monk who keeps the wheel rolling,
thag17.2:34.2_0: he is very wise and serene.
thag17.2:34.3_0: Like earth, like water, like fire,
thag17.2:34.4_0: he is neither attracted nor repelled.
thag17.2:35.1_0: He has attained the perfection of wisdom,
thag17.2:35.3_0: He is bright, but seems to be dull;
thag17.2:36.4_0: the attachment to rebirth is eradicated.”
thag17.2:4.1_0: If they cover themselves with a robe
thag17.2:4.2_0: that’s allowable and fit for purpose;
thag17.2:5.2_0: the rain doesn’t fall on the knees;
thag17.2:6.1_0: A mendicant who sees pleasure as pain,
thag17.2:6.3_0: and that there’s nothing between the two—
thag17.2:6.4_0: what keeps you in the world? What would you become?
thag17.2:7.1_0: Thinking, ‘May I have nothing to do with those of bad wishes,
thag17.2:7.4_0: what keeps you in the world? What would you become?
thag17.2:8.4_0: let them stand at the head.”
